page.title: 12Landscape
page.content: Black Castle_oldest house in East Terrace ,South Queensferry,was built in 1626.It was originally three floors high until it was remodernized. The Hawes Inn lies on the estuary, next to the Forth Rail Bridge.It is mentioned in Robert Louis Stevenson's "Kidnapped". Plewlands House 17th Century owned the National Trust.Was once home of Burgesses,merchants and ship masters of Queensferry.It was due to be demolished in plans for road_widening but was saved. Barnbourgh, Castle a ruin until 1881 when it was rebuilt as to keep,belonged to the Moubray family on the shores of the Forth in Dalmeny Estate,it is said to be haunted by a hound which died with its master in the Crusades.
